algorithm_technique: String splitting, in-place sorting (cycle sort variant), and string joining
problem_summary_simple: Reconstruct an original sentence from a shuffled version where each word has its position appended.
problem_summary_technical: Split the shuffled sentence, sort words based on their appended digit, and then remove the digits to form the original sentence.
key_insights: Each word in the shuffled sentence contains its original 1-indexed position as the last character.
The problem can be solved by sorting the words based on these appended numbers.
An in-place sorting approach (similar to cycle sort) can be used to rearrange the words efficiently.
After sorting, the numbers need to be removed from each word before joining them back into a sentence.
